name: showboat
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
someone who behaves or plays a sport in a way that is intended to attract attention or admiration, especially when this is annoying: He's not a showboat and isn't comfortable attracting attention to himself. He's a showboat outfielder who's famous for his flamboyant catches. See
showboating
More examplesFewer examplesI passed 30 pieces of legislation that session but I wasn't a showboat, I didn't toot my own horn, I didn't cultivate the press.He's not a showboat: "He's not like, 'Look at me, I'm here,'" says his co-star.He was no daredevil, preferring calculated risks to showboat stunts.
